repetitions.exitCondition: Subjects responding to second-line combination chemotherapy after 2 or 3 cycles (PR or CR) should proceed to high-dose therapy (HDT) and autologous stem cell transplant (ASCT).
repetitions.sourceText: Up to 3 cycles (6 to 9 weeks) of combination chemotherapy will be administered every 2 to 3 weeks.
receive a 3 day conditioning chemotherapy regimen consisting of fludarabine 30 mg/m2/day and cyclophosphamide 500 mg/m2/day (day -5 to day -3)

repetitions.exitCondition: Minimum 7 days unless otherwise required by country regulatory agencies
repetitions.sourceText: Subjects will be under an observation period for at least 7 days after axicabtagene ciloleucel infusion to monitor for and manage any adverse events
subjects who received at least one dose of axicabtagene ciloleucel as protocol therapy will complete the remainder of the 15-year follow-up assessments

traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'Randomized to Axicabtagene Ciloleucel Arm', 'path': ['CONDITIONING_CHEMOTHERAPY', 'AXI_CEL_INFUSION_DAY_0', 'POST_INFUSION_MONITORING']}, {'condition': 'Randomized to Standard of Care (SOC) Arm', 'path': ['SALVAGE_COMBINATION_CHEMOTHERAPY', 'RESPONSE_ASSESSMENT', 'HIGH_DOSE_THERAPY_AND_ASCT_IF_RESPONDER']}, {'condition': 'Non-responder to SOC chemotherapy', 'path': ['OFF_PROTOCOL_TREATMENT', 'SURVIVAL_FOLLOW_UP']}]

executionTypes.rationale: Assessment of age-adjusted International Prognostic Index (IPI) and stratification factors occurs once at the time of screening.
Subjects are randomized in a 1:1 ratio once to either axicabtagene ciloleucel or SOC.
SOC consists of a protocol-defined platinum-based salvage combination chemotherapy regimen administered in cycles.

executionTypes.activityId: High-dose therapy (HDT) and autologous stem cell transplant (ASCT)
executionTypes.rationale: Conditional workflow where subjects only proceed to HDT and ASCT if they achieve a partial response (PR) or complete response (CR) to second-line chemotherapy.
The DSMB meets continuously every 6 months after the first subject is randomized to review safety data over the duration of the trial.
Continuous monitoring from the time of randomization until the earliest date of disease progression, new therapy, or death.

executionTypes.activityId: Patient Reported Outcomes (PROs) and Quality of Life (QoL)
executionTypes.rationale: Evaluations of PROs and QoL are typically scheduled at specific repeated intervals/visits throughout the study period.

footnoteConditions.text: a. Physical Exam: Subjects with new-onset symptoms related to CRS should undergo physical examination at least daily until symptoms resolve to baseline.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: a. Physical Exam: Subjects with new-onset symptoms related to CRS should undergo physical examinatio

footnoteConditions.text: b. Neurologic assessment: A neurological assessment should be done prior to axicabtagene ciloleucel infusion on treatment day 0, then on treatment day 1 and every other day during the minimum 7-day observation period.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: b. Neurologic assessment: A neurological assessment should be done prior to axicabtagene ciloleucel

footnoteConditions.text: c. Echo: Performed following the subjects last chemotherapy treatment and within 28 days prior to signing the consent may be used for confirmation of eligibility

footnoteConditions.text: d. PET-CT disease assessment: PET-CT should be performed as close to randomization as possible and within 28 days prior to randomization.

footnoteConditions.text: f. Blood draw for anti-axicabtagene ciloleucel antibodies: Baseline antibody samples to be collected prior to start of leukapheresis.

footnoteConditions.sourceText: f. Blood draw for anti-axicabtagene ciloleucel antibodies: Baseline antibody samples to be collected

footnoteConditions.text: g. Lumbar Puncture: Subjects with new onset Grade >= 2 neurologic symptoms post axicabtagene ciloleucel infusion will have lumbar puncture performed.

footnoteConditions.text: h. Blood draws for PBMCs, cytokines, and additional analysis per Section 7.11.2.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: h. Blood draws for PBMCs, cytokines, and additional analysis per Section 7.11.2.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Event-free Survival (EFS)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Prolonged EFS compared to SOC (hypothesized 50% improvement)
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: EFS is defined as the time from randomization to the earliest date of disease progression per the Lugano Classification {Cheson 2014}, commencement of new lymphoma therapy, or death from any cause.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Statistically significant improvement compared to SOC
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: To evaluate the effect of axicabtagene ciloleucel compared to SOC on objective response rate (ORR), as detennined by blinded centrnl review

endpointAlgorithms.name: Overall Survival (OS)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Statistically significant improvement compared to SOC
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: To evaluate the effect of axicabtagene ciloleucel compared to SOC on overall survival (OS)

endpointAlgorithms.name: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: To evaluate the effect of axicabtagene ciloleucel compared to SOC on progression-free smvival (PFS)

endpointAlgorithms.name: Quality of Life Change (EORTC QLQ-C30)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Improvement or maintenance of global health status/physical functioning
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Changes from screening to post baseline in the global health status QoL scale and the physical functioning domain of the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Ques

derivedVariables.name: Event-free Survival
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Time from randomization to the date of first documentation of progression, death from any cause, or commencement of new anti-lymphoma therapy.
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Study duration until event or censoring
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censoring rules per protocol for subjects without events

derivedVariables.name: ORR
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Proportion of subjects who achieve a best response of CR or PR.

derivedVariables.name: OS
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Time from randomization to the date of death from any cause.
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at date last known alive

derivedVariables.name: Progression-free Survival
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Time from randomization to the date of first documentation of progression or death from any cause.
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Study duration until event or censoring

derivedVariables.name: Duration of Response
sourceVariables: Date of First Response (CR or PR)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Time from the first objective response to the date of progression or death.
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Date of first documented CR or PR
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at date of last evaluable disease assessment

derivedVariables.name: Time to Next Therapy
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Time from randomization to the start date of the first new anti-lymphoma therapy.
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at last contact or death

transitions.trigger: Progress to Long Term Follow Up
